block.p: Carin Leigh Bronner, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Bronner Jr. of Glen Rock, N.J., was married yesterday to Craig James Chapman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. E. John Chapman of Rye, England. The Rev. Carl Beavers, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Chapel of the Sacred Heart in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming. The Rev. Jerry Everley, a United Methodist minister, took part in the service.

Until this month, Mrs. Chapman, 33, was a pediatric clinical nurse at Children's Hospital of New York-Presbyterian Hospital. She graduated from St. Lawrence University and received bachelor's and master's degrees in nursing from New York University. Her father is an information technology consultant. Her mother, Elaine F. Bronner, is a nurse practitioner.

Carin Leigh Bronner, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Bronner Jr. of Glen Rock, N.J., was married yesterday to Craig James Chapman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. E. John Chapman of Rye, England. The Rev. Carl Beavers, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Chapel of the Sacred Heart in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming. The Rev. Jerry Everley, a United Methodist minister, took part in the service.

Until this month, Mrs. Chapman, 33, was a pediatric clinical nurse at Children's Hospital of New York-Presbyterian Hospital. She graduated from St. Lawrence University and received bachelor's and master's degrees in nursing from New York University. Her father is an information technology consultant. Her mother, Elaine F. Bronner, is a nurse practitioner.

Mr. Chapman, 35, is a candidate for a doctorate in business administration at Harvard, where he received an M.B.A. He graduated from Oxford and also received a master's in mathematics there. His mother, Inga Chapman, retired as the headmistress of the Lydd Primary School in Lydd, England. His father retired as a nuclear engineer at the Dungeness Nuclear Power Station.
